posts.author: Mithril Jack
posts.content:
First, taking SD at level 7 won't hurt you. I don't know why he took it so late; perhaps he felt that the monk boni were more important than HIPS or he wanted I higher BAB early on.


You need a weapon focus in a melee weapon (not unarmed combat) to qualify for COT. Also you need 4 pre-epic levels in a full BAB class to maximize your attacks per round. Assuming you are playing either a halfling or an elf, COT or blackguard are your only choices if you don't want an experience penalty, and because of your low charisma blackguard will give you -1 to your saves.


Depending on the environment in which you are you playing, an XP penalty may be acceptable to you. I wouldn't try this in the OC or SOU/HotU, for example, but a PW that gives high experience would be fine. If so then replacing COT with fighter would lessen your saves by 5, but give you some more feats to play with (weapon specialization:unarmed).


Finally, assuming that your game is fully patched, note that you won't be able to take epic dodge until level 27, the minimum level that you can achieve 30 ranks in tumble. Griz's build, though excellent as always, is 6 years old and some things have changed since then.

Mithril Jack wrote:First, taking SD at level 7 won't hurt you. I don't know why he took it so late; perhaps he felt that the monk boni were more important than HIPS or he wanted I higher BAB early on.
Grizz took the SD when he did to max his bab early on. And the build works out best that way. I have played this build through the OC and on a couple of PW's with great success. But Grizz will be the first to tell you, these are templates, not a bible. There is always room for customization.
Mithril Jack wrote:
You need a weapon focus in a melee weapon (not unarmed combat) to qualify for COT. Also you need 4 pre-epic levels in a full BAB class to maximize your attacks per round. Assuming you are playing either a halfling or an elf, COT or blackguard are your only choices if you don't want an experience penalty, and because of your low charisma blackguard will give you -1 to your saves.
This build does get a focus in a melee weapon at 15 with the Kama. that takes care to the CoT requirement.

Mithril Jack wrote:
Finally, assuming that your game is fully patched, note that you won't be able to take epic dodge until level 27, the minimum level that you can achieve 30 ranks in tumble. Griz's build, though excellent as always, is 6 years old and some things have changed since then.
The one thing that did not change, however, is that this build still rocks. I have done one for each race, except gnome (I consider them to be comic relief). Each one seems to do great. It does take some management, but that can be said with most builds.


Finally, marshall, you have a good choice for a build there. this is 'the' most versatile monk build I have ever seen. As I stated above, I reworked some of the stats a bit and managed to get a version for all the races, except gnome. One lvl in SD for the HiPS may or may not work out. I just hope that Grizz or Din see this and can set thing straight. The build is old, but still viable.
